meanings.definition: Characterized by comprehension of the parts of something as intimately interconnected and explicable only by reference to the whole.
meanings.sent1: The holistic approach to healthcare considers the entire person, not just individual symptoms.
meanings.sent2: She took a holistic view of the situation, considering all aspects before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The holistic detective solved the case by connecting all the seemingly unrelated clues.
meanings.sent4: Her holistic understanding of the ecosystem helped her protect the delicate balance of nature.
meanings.sent5: The holistic treatment focused on healing the mind, body, and spirit together.

meanings.definition: Concerned with wholes rather than analysis or separation into parts.
meanings.sent1: The holistic approach to education emphasizes the importance of seeing the big picture.
meanings.sent2: He preferred a holistic approach to problem-solving, looking at the entire system rather than individual components.
meanings.sent3: The holistic baker believed that each ingredient played a crucial role in creating the perfect cake.
meanings.sent4: Her holistic perspective on business helped her see how each department contributed to the company's success.
meanings.sent5: The holistic gardener understood that every plant in the garden played a part in the overall beauty of the landscape.
